put.description: Records a user's activity completion by creating or updating an activity log entry with the provided ID. This endpoint is useful for idempotent operations when you need to ensure the same activity completion is not recorded multiple times.

parameters.name: activityLogId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the activity log. Must be a nanoid string.

200.description: Activity log created or updated successfully

400.description: Invalid input - missing required fields, validation errors, or ID format issues

message.description: Error message describing the validation issue

path.description: Path to the field with error

post.description: Allows a user to send virtual currency to another user. Multiple transaction requests can be batched. The source user is always the authenticated caller. Operations are atomic (all or nothing). It is strongly recommended to include an 'X-Idempotency-Key' header for safe retries.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

200.description: Virtual transactions created successfully. Returns the transactions from the point of view of the caller.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input, validation error (e.g., negative amount), or other processing error.

404.description: Not Found - Referenced entity (e.g., destinationUserId, virtualCurrencyId) not found.

409.description: Conflict - Potential duplicate request based on idempotency key and request content. Another cause could be that at least one of the operations would conflict with a user's counterpart boundary (minAllowedBalance or maxAllowedBalance)

get.description: Retrieves a specific virtual transaction by its ID for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: virtualTransactionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the virtual transaction.

post.description: Redeems a specific pending credit virtual transaction for the authenticated user. This action is typically available for transactions with 'MANUAL' redemption mode. Redeeming a transaction may also complete other related transactions (e.g., a corresponding debit) if they share the same redemptionGroupId.

parameters.name: virtualTransactionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the virtual transaction to redeem.

200.description: Virtual transaction redeemed successfully. Returns all affected transactions.

400.description: Bad Request - Transaction Id does not match specified format.

404.description: Not Found - The specified virtualTransactionId does not exist for current user.

409.description: Conflict - The transaction is not in a state that allows redemption (e.g., already completed, expired, or rejected).

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - The transaction is not in a state that allows redemption (e.g., already completed, expired, or rejected) or is not a credit transaction.

oauth2.description: OAuth2 Client Credentials Flow. Use the /oauth2/token endpoint to obtain an access token, then use it in all API requests. IMPORTANT: Token URL depends on environment - Production: https://auth.aworld.cloud/oauth2/token | Development: https://auth.aworld.services/oauth2/token

AppMissionAssignment.description: Represents a mission assigned to a user, tailored for app display.

missionAssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the mission assignment.

missionRuleId.description: Optional. Identifier of the mission rule that triggered this assignment.

periodId.description: Identifier for the specific period of a recurring mission assignment.

timeframeType.description: The timeframe type of this assignment.

startsAt.description: Start date-time of this mission assignment.

endsAt.description: Optional. End date-time of this mission assignment.

completedAt.description: Optional. Timestamp when the mission assignment was completed.

isCompleted.description: Indicates if the mission assignment is completed.

state.description: Current state of the mission assignment.

groupTagId.description: If missionType is 'GROUP', the tag ID of the assigned group.

userId.description: If missionType is 'INDIVIDUAL', the ID of the assigned user.

currentAmount.description: Current progress amount towards the target.

targetAmount.description: Target amount required for mission completion.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the assignment was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the assignment was last updated.

origin.description: Whether the quiz comes from a central catalog or is custom-created

quizCatalogId.description: ID reference to the original quiz in the catalog if applicable

syncWithCatalog.description: Whether the quiz should be synced with catalog updates

placement.description: The context in which the quiz is used

defaultLang.description: The default language code for the quiz content

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the quiz was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the quiz was last updated

QuizTranslation.description: Translation content for a quiz, including questions and answer options

quizId.description: ID of the quiz this translation belongs to

opt1.description: Text for the first answer option

opt2.description: Text for the second answer option

opt3.description: Text for the third answer option

opt4.description: Text for the fourth answer option

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the translation was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the translation was last updated

CreateActivityLogRequest.description: Data required to create a new activity log entry

activityId.description: Identifier of the activity that was completed. Must match an existing activity in the system.

userId.description: Identifier of the user who completed the activity

outcome.description: Result of the activity completion. If not provided, no outcome is recorded.

value.description: Numerical value associated with the activity completion. Can represent points, progress, or any quantifiable measure.

tags.description: Associated tags for categorization and filtering. Tags can be used to group related activity completions.

additionalData.description: Any additional data related to the activity completion. This can include custom fields specific to the activity type.

completedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was completed. Must be in ISO 8601 format.

ActivityLog.description: Record of a completed activity by a user

activityLogId.description: Unique identifier for this activity log entry, generated as a nanoid if not provided

activityId.description: Identifier of the activity that was completed

userId.description: Identifier of the user who completed the activity

value.description: Numerical value associated with the activity completion

tags.description: Associated tags for categorization and filtering. Can be used for reporting and analytics.

additionalData.description: Any additional data related to the activity completion. This flexible field allows for storing custom information related to the specific activity.

completedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was completed

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this record was created in the system

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when this record was last updated

accountId.description: The account ID associated with this activity log

workspaceId.description: The workspace ID associated with this activity log

sourceRegion.description: AWS region where this activity log was created

CreateUserRequest.description: Data required to create a new user

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the user was last updated

VirtualBalance.description: Virtual Currency Balance representation for client applications, with sensitive data removed

virtualCurrencyId.description: The ID of the Virtual Currency to which this balance pertains.

userId.description: The ID of the User to whom this balance belongs.

amount.description: The total current amount of the virtual currency owned by the user.

availableAmount.description: The amount of virtual currency that the user can currently spend. This amount considers any pending debit operations.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this virtual balance record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when this virtual balance record was last updated.

VirtualTransactionInput.description: Input for a single transaction initiated by an app user.

virtualCurrencyId.description: The ID of the virtual currency to be transacted.

destinationUserId.description: The ID of the user who will receive the virtual currency.

redemptionMode.description: The redemption mode for the transaction.

amount.description: The amount of virtual currency to send. Must be a positive value.

expiresAt.description: Optional ISO date-time string. If provided and redemptionMode is MANUAL, the transaction will expire at this time if not completed.

CreateVirtualTransactionsRequest.description: Request body for creating virtual transactions from the App API.

transactions.description: A list of transaction inputs. Minimum 1 item.

CreateVirtualTransactionsResponse.description: Response body after creating virtual transactions from the App API.

transactions.description: A list of the created virtual transactions, from the point of view of the calling user.

RedeemVirtualTransactionResponse.description: Response body after redeeming a virtual transaction. Includes all affected transactions.

transactions.description: A list of virtual transactions directly affecting the authenticated user that were updated by the redemption (e.g., the redeemed credit transaction, now in a COMPLETED state). Any other linked transactions (like a counterpart's debit) will be processed internally but not typically returned in this App API response.

virtualTransactionId.description: Unique identifier for the virtual transaction.

userId.description: The ID of the User to whom this transaction pertains.

virtualCurrencyId.description: Identifier of the virtual currency involved in the transaction.

amount.description: The amount of virtual currency transacted. Positive for credit, negative for debit (direction field also indicates actual movement).

direction.description: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit for the user.

state.description: The current state of the transaction. Expired transactions are evaluated lazily and their state is updated when trying to redeem them.

initiator.description: Identifier of the entity that initiated the transaction (e.g., userId, ruleId, system process name).

initiatorType.description: The type of entity that initiated the transaction.

counterpart.description: Identifier of the counterpart in the transaction (e.g., another userId, system entity).

redemptionMode.description: Defines wether the transaction is automatically redeemed or not. If redemptionMode is MANUAL, the transaction will be pending until this transaction (if at credit) or the counterpart transaction (if at debit) is redeemed.

virtualTransactionGroupId.description: Identifier for a group of related transactions that was processed (created) together ad a database transaction.

redemptionGroupId.description: Identifier for a grouping related transactions (credit and debit counterparts) where redemptionMode was MANUAL. When the credit ledger transaction is redeemed, all transactions in the group are redeemed together.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction record was last updated.

redeemedAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction was redeemed (ex, state changed to COMPLETED).

expiresAt.description: Optional Timestamp that reflects the expiration date of the transaction when redemptionMode is MANUAL and state is PENDING. If not provided, the transaction will never expire.
